item.title: Over Grown unmaintained willow trees, 11th September
item.description:
I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to raise an urgent concern regarding the overgrown trees in our neighbourhood. Despite my repeated attempts to bring this issue to your attention, the situation has worsened significantly. During recent windy conditions, the tree branches have been flying dangerously, Bashing to the front of my house, doors, windows, and even my car. I am raising an insurance claim for the damages caused by roots, However, this is not just a matter of personal inconvenience. The current state of these trees poses a severe safety hazard to pedestrians and children playing in the park. The roots of the trees are also causing damage to the surrounding areas, and the overhanging branches obstruct the pathways, making it difficult for people to walk safely. I kindly request that you take immediate action to address this issue. It is essential to ensure the safety and wellbeing of all residents and visitors to the park. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I have made a video however can not send so attached are some snaps from the footage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crouch Croft, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uncollected yellow barrier….., 11th September
item.description:
Yet AGAIN! Weeks after repair to dislodged kerbstone…where is the contractor’s manager/supervisor of works? See attached 7am Thursday 11 September photos….. Please INSTRUCT the contractor to remove FORTHWITH, DEFAULT the contractor and make it VERY CLEAR to them this is UNACCEPTABLE….. I trust that the contractor will NOT be paid and will suffer financial penalty for failing REPEATEDLY to do jobs 100% PROPERLY…. How many times Bromley Council does one have to raise this with you? You MUST do better…… And is Mr Jones (along with Mr Horsman….) still based at Stockwell Close? Or have they moved back? See this week’s News Shopper public announcement pages…..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): School Road, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
